instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Hello,
I have a Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that came in for "Not Getting On".

It draws 20V on the amp meter. Customer showed it to some shop and they said that it is a SSD Issue. 

I can see a few Caps repalced like <CAPACITOR>C9589</CAPACITOR> / <CAPACITOR>C9587</CAPACITOR>.

Can we verify if its actually a SSD issue or not or if it can be brought back to life.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings on SSD power lines with good board.
What voltages did you check on the MLB?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.6V.
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> is 2.5V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0_SNS</SIGNAL> is 12.6V.

SSD Power Rails Means all 0v9 , 1v8 and 2v5 SSD Lines as per the schematics right ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Yes.

No need to check other PPBUS points; can't get different readings.

I expected some voltage reading on the big coils; RAM, PCH, CPU...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Diode Mode Readings of SSD Power Rails

L9521 is .352
L9520 is .310
L9530 IS .311
L9021 IS .391
L9020 IS.398
L9030 IS .345
<RESISTOR>R9520</RESISTOR> IS .298
L9080 IS .334
<CAPACITOR>C9091</CAPACITOR> IS .351

Voltage Readings of the Big Coils
L7410 0V
L7420 0V
L7211 0V
L7221 0V
L7231 0V
L7330 0V
LA750 0V
LA850 0V
LA860 0V
LA870 0V
LA950 0V
LA710/720/730/740 0V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: I don't see any mention about L6960, L7600/60, L7701, L8102.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
It should be detected in DFU.
If no data to save, go for restore.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
the machine was detected in recovery mode. Forced it into DFU Mode. But it shows an error during restore Invalid State.
Then it automatically went into Recovery Again, did a restore again. I got a apple logo with loading bar (almost 90% Full already).
It is stuck half way at Step 4 of 4 : Installing System

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: Gave up waiting for device to transition from RestoreOS state to BootedOS state.  [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFC9 (4041)]

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Use 96/140W charger.
Connect charger cable before DFU cable.
Also let the battery connected too.

Force machine off and start in DFU, not recovery.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: Last Restore was with Battery Connected. I ll try it tomorrow and update

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Followed the instructions but i got this error.
Device added from invalid state Restoring - This means that either we got a disconnection during restore, or we got the connect event twice [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFAA (4010)]

One more thing. When i pluggged in the charger first (battery connected) i got a brief Battery sign and fan spin.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: It again showed up in recovery mode. This time with the charger plugged in i did a restore and it was successful. The machine got on with the question mark folder. Doing an internet recovery . Updating when done.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: The internet recovery did not complete Machine heats up and fan goes to max and shuts down. What should i do?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Are you using 96/140W charger?
The battery takes charge?
Any error pops up starting in diagnostic mode?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
I am using a 96W charger.
I assume its taking charge as the device is running off the battery alone.

Diagnostics Mode - 

No Issue Found
ADP000

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Try again Internet recovery.
May have more luck using ethernet cable.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: Okay. Let me try that too. If that doesnt work then Non Repairable?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: Did it with an ethernet cable. It got much further this time. But again the same thing.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message:
Very likely no solution in this case.
May has SSD problems, or GPU, even CPU.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> SSD ISsue
threads.message: okay
